alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Kearney (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 15 at 1:37PM CST until December 15 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CST FOR CLAY...WESTERN NUCKOLLS...EASTERN FRANKLIN...WEBSTER...ADAMS... NORTHEASTERN KEARNEY...SOUTHWESTERN HAMILTON...BUFFALO...SOUTHWESTERN MERRICK...EASTERN SHERMAN...HOWARD AND HALL COUNTIES... At 136 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Riverdale to near Heartwell to near Inavale, moving northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Kenesaw and Heartwell around 140 PM CST. Shelton, Pleasanton and Prosser around 145 PM CST. Wood River, Cowles and Poole around 150 PM CST. Ravenna, Blue Hill, Alda and Rosemont around 155 PM CST. Lawrence, Rockville and Boelus around 200 PM CST. Grand Island, Ashton and Deweese around 205 PM CST. Fairfield, Glenvil, Farwell and St. Libory around 210 PM CST. Clay Center, Elba and Inland around 215 PM CST. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 267 and 332. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for north central Kansas...and south central and central Nebraska. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
